page.title: 18GOVERNMENT IN ASHILL
page.content: Both the local{M.P. and M.E.P.}make occasional visits to the village but contact is mainly by letter. The {County Council}Representative is a farmer from Hillborough (Conservative) and the{District Councillor}(Cons) owns an engineering company in the village. There is an active{Parish Council}of 7 members and it is non-political. The council is responsible for Street Lights, Footpaths, hiring of Allotments etc, and puts the village view to the District and County Councils. Currently one of their main concerns is a pavement from the Swaffham Rd. Council Houses to church St. They meet once a month in the Community Centre and regularly invite members of the village to come to meetings to "air" their views.
